article.title: Time Domain Neural Audio Style Transfer

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 depicts an example synthesis of:
choices: The difference between real and imaginary components of a DFT.
Audio optimized directly, with source content and style audible.

multiple_choice_question.text: The article discusses a variety of computational graphs that begin with a **Discrete Fourier Transform (DFT)**. What is the purpose of using a DFT in this context?
choices: To visualize the audio signal as a spectrogram.
To compress the audio signal for faster processing.
To decompose the audio signal into its real and imaginary components for manipulation.
To identify the fundamental frequency and harmonics of the audio signal.

multiple_choice_question.text: The article explores representing the **phase** of an audio signal in various ways. Which of these is NOT a phase representation mentioned in the article?

The study found that only one network achieved meaningful audio reconstruction with preserved style and content. Which combination of information did this successful network utilize as concatenated features?
choices: Activations from a pre-trained WaveNet decoder
Activations from a pre-trained NSynth encoder
